sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3}. Find (A × B) ∩ {1, 2, 3} and (B × {1, 2}) ∩ {1, 2, 3}. Show that (A × B) ∩ {1, 2, 3} ≠ (B × {1, 2}) ∩ {1, 2, 3} and prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not associative with respect to intersection.
